creator: bakey@traq.com
text:
In the httpd.conf
<Directory "/www/html">
    Options Indexes Includes FollowSymLinks

If Includes if removed last-modified date comes back.
This is causing browser caching issues.
Apache2 is also stripping the last-modified date from a server proxied machine 
that is servered by apache, no matter if includes are turned on or off.

creator: bakey@traq.com
text:
SetOutputFilter INCLUDES;DEFLATE
is in the httpd.conf

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Well, then you should be more restrictive in your setting. The INCLUDES filter
removes the Last-Modified header (for obvious reasons, I think).

You'll need something like

AddOutputFilterByType INCLUDES text/html

instead of a general SetOutputFilter.

Thanks for using Apache.

creator: bakey@traq.com
text:
Turning off deflate fixed the problem. I still would like to use it with 
deflate turned on.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
The deflate filter doesn't touch Last-Modified.

SetOutputFilter DEFLATE

<Directory /foo>
  Options +Includes
  AddOutputFilterByType INCLUDES text/html
</Directory>

removes the last-modified from your *.gif files?

That fixes it. In the past if I did setoutputfilter deflate the includes quit 
working unless I also put them in the setoutputfilter. 2.0.45 seems to have 
fixed this. Thanks.
creator: bakey@traq.com
